185983495.review:
Absolutely incredible and stunning work of art. Each Bioshock game can be considered as such in their own right but the execution and scope of Infinite take the cake.

Bioshock Inifinte is a hugely philosophically exploratory piece of work that finds its narrative revolving around fascistic religious despotism and metaphysical science fiction. Booker DeWitt is tasked with finding a woman and returning her to his benefactors. The opening of the game sends him straight into the sky where he has to make his way through a multitude of neighborhoods in a cloud city to track this person down.

The storytelling here is hardly matched. One of the greatest games ever written. Gameplay is also fantastic with punchy and responsive guns and the vigor system which allows a lot of variation in how a player can approach different combat encounters.

It is a fairly linear game which could be a turn off to some but it's a beast of a thing once the ball gets rolling and maintains engagement through the rich and dense world, characters, and plot. It's a game I'd consider everyone should play at some point.

Знаешь, есть игры, которые просто включаешь, отстреливаешь пару врагов и такой:''Ну норм''. А есть игры, которые садят тебя в кресло, завязывают глаза, пускают по рельсам и потом выбрасывают с фейерверком в мультивселенную разрыва мозга. BioShock infinite- это как раз про второе.

185837921.review:
Pois é guys, demorei um pouco para escrever esta analise aqui. E pra falar a verdade, num sei nem por onde começar.
Mas vou dizer o que eu fiz logo de cara! 

Baxei > Instalei > Joguei > Finalizei.
Tudo isso numa tacada só, e sinceramente??? BioShock Infinite envelheceu bem d+++.

A começar pelo enredo/historia que desde o inicio pode parecer um pouco complexa ou dificil de entender, mas que pro late game chega a ser ABSOLUTE CINEMA TOTAL, com um plot twist digno, num final espetacular. É simplesmente coisa de loco, sem maldade mesmo. Muito F0DA! Nesse ponto a 2K acertou em cheio. 
Dessa vez, a cidade em que o jogo se passa se chama Columbia. Diferente de Rapture, em vez da trama ser num lugar subaquatico, começamos nossa aventura aos céus. Que por sinal, a falta de uma paleta de cores mais vivas que no I & II não tiveram (que ao meu ver é proposital até...), aqui tem de sobra. É bem lindo as nuvens, os palacios, os diversos estabelecimentos espalhados pela cidade, tudo!!! A coloração agrada os olhos. 

Durante a campanha, comandamos Booker DeWitt, um cara de 37 anos, muito depressivo, amargurado e endividado, que acabou se viciando em bebidas e jogos de azar, por conta da morte de sua esposa. 
Ele acaba sendo abordado por um casal, que lhe oferece quitar as suas dividas em troca de um pequeno serviço: Ir a Columbia e resgatar uma mulher, Elizabeth. 

Agora, se tratando dos personagens do game, quero deixar claro que TODOS foram muito bem feitos & criados. Tantos os inimigos como a Daisy [Lider da Vox Populi], e o Antagonista principal Comstock, até o próprio Songbird, que deveria ter sim mais protagonismo no jogo, afinal ele era o "garoto propaganda" de Infinite. Mas o ponto a onde quero chegar é sobre a propria Elizabeth!!! Ouso a dizer que ela esta nos top 10 personagens femininas mais SENSACIONAIS da historia dos Videogames... e creio eu que não seria nenhum exagero afirmar isso.

A personalidade dela é algo muito especial.
Uma garota de 19 anos, bonita, educada, simpatica, que durante a jogatina se mostra EXTREMAMENTE UTIL, abrindo portas trancadas e te dando munição durante os confrontos! Sempre quando o combate aperta, ela vai esta la te ajudando.
Eu acho que ela teve uma leve inspiração em pontos especificos da Alyx de Half Life 2, mas com algumas coisinhas melhores. Ela é tão pika, mas tão pika, que até rouba a cena em certos trechos do jogo. 

Os graficos pra época são show!!!
A ambientação é de tirar o chapéu. Os moradores da cidade, os lugares e até as armas tem um design de arte maravilhoso, rico em detalhes. Ja a parte de trilha sonora é magistral. Remete muito a 1912, ano em que se passa o game. As dublagens & traduções estão impecaveis também! Em sua maioria, a qualidade deste titulo em especifico é TUDO acima do normal. 

Bom, aqui realmente não temos Little Sister's & Big Daddy's pelos lugares a fora, como no 1 e no 2, mas te garanto com certeza absoluta que a ação é triplicada em Infinite. Desde a locomoção dos trilhos espalhados pela city, até as trocações de tiros com os civis, maquinas e até fantasmas. Altamente ESPLENDOROSO ^^ 

E então é isso galera... é ÓBVIO que recomendo essa MASTERPIECE do karay que é BioShock Infinite!!!!! Se você ficou muito curioso(a) pra saber como é a experiencia, pode comprar full price que eu garanto que não havera arrependimentos.
Mas se a grana ta curta, direto & reto BioShock aparece em promoção com o bundle da trilogia completa. Dai é só comprar, baxar, jogar e ser feliz *-* 

Gostaria de deixar o meu Muito Obrigado a você que chegou e leu até aqui, e nos vemos na proxima. Falow e até mais! 
Score magico a seguir: 


NOTA – 1OOOO/1O

185738214.review: Потрясающая сюжетная компания! Дает фору современным проектам, а игре 12-13 лет. Глядя на современную игровую индустрию становится смешно и ты начинаешь осознавать каким же второсортными поигрулями нас кормят за 6-7 тысяч. Раньше все же разработчики были заинтересованы в том, что бы родить действительное что-то годное, что-то уникальное. Проект вышел настолько удачным и так полюбился игрокам, что те запили действительно годную русскую локализацию, причем перевели не только диалоги, а вообще нахер все. И в 2025 году играется данный проект крайне хорошо, кайф с геймплея, кайф с визуала, кайф с атмосферы, игра определенно прошла проверку временем. Игра не стесняется поднимать щепетильные темы и обмусоливать их. Определенно Bioshock Infite прошел проверку временем. Хотелось бы увидеть полноценный ремейк данной игры с обновленным гемплеем, именно ремейк, а не ремастеред с обновленными текстурами. Игра обязательно к ознакомлению!

185634411.review:
Для меня BioShock Infinite был интересным игровым опытом, потому что до того, как я поиграл в эту игру, я не встречал ничего подобного. Весь процесс был увлекательным, и я прошел игру довольно быстро, всего за две игровые сессии.


 [h3]Из плюсов данной игры могу выделить следующее: [/h3]

[b]Графика[/b] – мультяшная, красочная и просто великолепная.

[b]Геймплей[/b] – это не просто шутер, а очень динамичный шутер. Помимо обычного оружия, есть восемь различных способностей, которые можно комбинировать, а также взаимодействовать со своим напарником.

[b]Сюжет[/b] – он действительно запутан, как по мне, но было интересно узнать, к чему все это приведет.

[b]Дизайн локаций[/b]– город выглядит просто шикарно. Мне очень нравилось ходить по локациям и искать секреты.


 [h3]Из минусов могу выделить следующее: [/h3]

[b]Некоторые моменты[/b] – в игре есть несколько душных моментов, их правда совсем немного, но это все равно неприятно.

[b]Донат[/b] – некоторые виды оружия можно получить только при покупке отдельного DLC с этим оружием. Поэтому я рекомендую приобретать полный набор из всех трех частей BioShock.



Мне было приятно погрузиться в Колумбию, и я с удовольствием прошел BioShock Infinite, что и вам рекомендую. Моя оценка – [b]9/10.[/b]

Думаю скореее нет, чем да. Детали возведены в абсолют, Элизабет один из самых проработанных спутников за всю игровую индустрию. Враги пиздос охуевшие, попадают хоть с другого конца карты. Расстроило немного что убрали мобильные аптечки и адам(соль).

Грустно что нет ручных сохранений, некоторые собирательные штуки пропустил из-за этого. Реализация интерфейса больше по душе в этой части, удобнее банально. Вобщем игра мне понравилась больше в плане сюжета, геймплея и атмосферы, чем прошлые части.
Оценка кому интересно 9.5/10.

185339140.review:
打小就听说，真是不折不扣的久仰大名。为了这碟醋试图把“前菜”一代二代玩完，但是玩完一代发现二代的美学和叙事无甚新意，更关键的是键位全乱了还不能改，遂直接启动无限。后来查阅相关资料，发现irrational games直接负责的只有一代和无限，属于是歪打正着。

生化奇兵系列的中文方块字始终又小又瘦又长，无限这一代还只有繁体，看得令人头疼。录音带还没有字幕了，不想练听力就只能打开菜单一点点翻着看。于是过完序章之后突发奇想，决定放弃理解剧情，只管一路突突突杀杀杀，说不定能找回小时候4399的快乐。现在玩完结局，补了剧情解析，觉得这是我在游戏上做过的最后悔的决定之一。

不论世界观的话，一代的叙事和演出效果可谓扁平；我带着甚低的预期去体验无限，自然被一次又一次地震撼。尤其是最后的结局演出，让我“看不懂但大为震撼”的同时，捶胸顿足之前没有静下心来看剧情。关掉游戏之后迫不及待打开麦教授2015年的名篇，跟着把故事及其内涵捋了一遍（顺便剧透了海葬）。于是晚上躺在床上翻来覆去睡不着，满脑子都是伊丽莎白在沙滩上转圈圈跳舞、“What happened will happen”、“No, I'm afraid of you”、“Bring us the girl and wipe away the debt”，还有最后漫天的灯塔和星门。

古人有云，在生化奇兵无限的评测中，对伊丽莎白发电是不可或缺的一部分。我发不出来，我的电都变成了眼泪在肚子里淌。麦教授说得好，为什么伊丽莎白是游戏史上最成功的AI队友之一？除了剧情加分和金牌辅助之外，还有最关键的一点：她在不挡路的前提下，始终走在你的身前，活跃在你的视野里，让你能够看到她的一颦一笑一举一动。时时刻刻都能看到对方，如此日久，方能生情。

睡不着听歌，随机播放到《滔滔》，听到“饮啦”那段鼻子一酸，于是又一首歌与一段特定的回忆和情绪绑定了。

185300023.review:
Unfortunately a significant downgrade on almost every aspect when compared to Bioshock 1 and 2, to a point where is hard to tell if this game can even be classified as a immersive sim. The open ended maps are gone, the arsenal is hefty but you're limited to two guns, this game's version of plasmids and tonics have been heavily simplified and the replayability factor suffers because of it, which seems to be the recurring story for almost every aspect of the gameplay. It mostly turned into a regular linear FPS, and while I do love those we are talking Bioshock here, one of the best series ever when it comes to player expression through its mechanics. They did later try to remedy this in Burial at Sea, but it was to little to late unfortunately

The best aspect of this game is definitely the visuals, the city is absolutely beautiful and the visual style is very unique, it could rival Rapture in this regard, but Rapture was so much more than just looks

The story here is all over the place, but what really ended up dragging it down more than any plot problems is that the setting is basically what every leftist dystopian fanfiction thinks will happen once their candidate doesn't win the election with a slight variation of "White Christian Americans=Bad". The previous games where very witty when presenting similar topics, never preaching nor ever feeling like it wasn't a extension of what the character worldview was, but once again that is not the case for Infinite, it's just straight up propaganda here and you can't go a couple of minutes without a verbal or visual reminder of it

Maybe it was a novel concept when this game came out, but playing Infinite on the current day after a decade of this being the only consistent topic in every form of media really destroys the experience unless you are part of the group of people that eats this stuff up. Nowadays we are stuck here where almost every big budget title's story is a cringy manifesto and unfortunately this might have been the one that started it all

Play Bioshock 1 and 2 instead, they are superior games in every single regard

185252318.review:
[b] Bioshock Infinite : Le faux berger Mr.D.Booker

°Introduction

Bioshock Infinite est un jeu vidéo développé par Irrational Games et sorti en 2013. Il se déroule dans un univers alternatif en 1912, dans la ville flottante de Columbia. Le jeu aborde des thèmes complexes, notamment le racisme, le nationalisme et le privilège.

°Amélioration

Le jeu a connu des améliorations significatives par rapport à ses prédécesseurs, notamment en termes de narration, de graphismes et de mécaniques de jeu. L'introduction de personnages plus profonds et d'une histoire engageante a enrichi l'expérience du joueur.

°Points positifs

Narration immersive : L'intrigue captivante et les rebondissements maintiennent l'intérêt des joueurs.
Personnages bien développés : Les protagonistes et antagonistes présentent des motivations claires et des arcs narratifs engageants.
Esthétique visuelle : Le design artistique de Columbia est à la fois unique et mémorable, avec une attention particulière aux détails.

°Points négatifs

Thèmes sensibles : Le traitement du racisme et des inégalités sociales a suscité des débats, certains le jugeant parfois trop caricatural.
Équilibrage du gameplay : Certains joueurs ont noté des déséquilibres dans le système de combat et les capacités des personnages.

°Esthétique ambiance

L'esthétique de Bioshock Infinite se caractérise par une combinaison de style steampunk et d'éléments d'architecture américaine du début du XXe siècle. La bande sonore, ainsi que les effets visuels, contribuent à créer une atmosphère immersive et souvent troublante.

°Équilibrage

Le jeu propose un système de choix qui influence l'expérience du joueur, bien que certaines mécaniques de gameplay n'aient pas été perçues comme parfaitement équilibrées, en particulier lors des affrontements avec des ennemis.

°Conclusion

Bioshock Infinite est un titre qui, malgré ses controverses liées au racisme et à d'autres thèmes sociaux, reste une œuvre marquante dans l'industrie du jeu vidéo. Son approche narrative et esthétique continue d'alimenter les discussions sur la représentation et la sensibilité dans les médias interactifs. [/b]

185233643.review:
A Beautiful Sky I Couldn’t Fully Soar In... 
Bioshock Infinite is undeniably a creative and ambitious game, but it ultimately wasn’t my cup of tea. 
While I can appreciate its artistry and craftsmanship, it never quite resonated with me the way I hoped it would.
Columbia, the floating city, is a breathtaking setting. 
Its bright, cloud-dappled skies and pristine streets are a stark contrast to the eerie depths of Rapture, and it’s a testament to the developers’ creativity. 
The game’s early moments, where you explore the city’s idyllic façade, are genuinely captivating. 
However, as the story unfolds, I found myself less enchanted by the city’s charm and more overwhelmed by its chaotic and sometimes convoluted narrative.
The relationship between Booker and Elizabeth is one of the game’s strongest points. 
Elizabeth’s character is vibrant and endearing, and her role as an AI companion is both innovative and well-executed. 
Yet, the overall story, with its heavy themes of multiverse theory and destiny, felt a bit too ambitious for its own good. 
I admire the effort to tackle such complex ideas, but the execution left me feeling more puzzled than intrigued.
Gameplay-wise, Bioshock Infinite offers a decent enough experience. 
The skylines are a fun and creative addition, adding verticality and dynamism to combat. 
However, the gunplay feels standard, and the lack of plasmids, replaced here by Vigors, made the combat feel less impactful compared to the previous Bioshock titles.
Despite these personal gripes, I can’t deny the effort and talent poured into Bioshock Infinite. 
The visuals are stunning, the voice acting is good, and the soundtrack adds an eerie yet majestic undertone to the journey. 
For many, this game is a masterpiece, but for me, it was more of a well-crafted curiosity that didn’t fully capture me.
In the end, Bioshock Infinite is a decent and undeniably creative game, but it didn’t leave me with the same awe and satisfaction as its predecessors. 
If you’re intrigued by its premise and unique setting, it’s worth exploring, but it might not click with everyone, and that’s okay.

185189391.review:
[h1] Обзор на игру BioShock Infinite [/h1]  

BioShock Infinite переносит игроков в необыкновенный мир Колумбии, наполненный уникальными темами и философией. Игра отличается от предыдущих частей, предлагая совершенно новые идеи и механики.  

[h2] Плюсы игры [/h2]  
[list]  
[*] Интересный мир: Колумбия и её жители — это многогранное общество с уникальной атмосферой и эстетикой.  
[*] Глубокие темы: игра поднимает вопросы о расизме, американской мечте и политике.  
[*] Великолепный сюжет: удивительная история с неожиданными поворотами и эмоциями.  
[*] Чарли и Элизабета: персонажи, которые вызывают искреннюю симпатию и эмоции.  
[*] Великолепное оформление и графика: Колумбия выглядит потрясающе благодаря детализированным окружениям.  
[/list]  

[h2] Минусы игры [/h2]  
[list]  
[*] Некоторые элементы могут быть чрезмерно линейными.  
[*] Довольно простые механики боя, несмотря на интересную концепцию с "слушателями".  
[*] Часто использующиеся временные механики, которые могут показаться искусственными.  
[/list]  

[h3] Заключение [/h3]  
BioShock Infinite — это не только технически продвинутая игра, но и произведение искусства, которое затрагивает важные темы, но имеет некоторые недостатки в плане геймплея и боевой системы.

185141949.review:
As expected, I already played Bioshock and Bioshock 2 (both the remastered versions)... Bioshock Infinite is definitely an improvement in pretty much all aspects. The most impressive aspect of it is the Elizabeth NPC character, that is truly the highlight of the gameplay.

And that's the thing I most liked about Bioshock Infinite, Elizabeth... Is not as "revolutionary" as Alyx Vance in Half-Life 2, but it's still a truly enjoyable character/"sidekick". After that, I would say the world design is gorgeous!

The thing I disliked the most... The plot!... I mean, It's interesting, but it was unnecessarily convoluted. The way is presented to the player is annoyingly obtuse and to be honest, I didn't really understood the "twist" until I saw a playthrough from Cynthetic (Youtuber). The plot is good and original, but the presentation/development was a miss.

One thing I really liked about this game compared to Bioshock 2 is the stability. Granted, I'm playing this game 2 or 3 years after I played Bioshock 2 (both in Linux), so game compatibility should have improved a ton, but still, not one single crash or bug, while in Bioshock 2 (remastered) I had about 50 game crashes during the entire playthrough.

Definitely recommended!

185062818.review:
Um FPS simples com uma história surpreendente.

[+] A cidade de Columbia
A premissa do jogo é simples: o personagem principal precisa ir até a cidade voadora de Columbia recuperar algo que promete livrá-lo de uma montanha de dívidas. Contudo, essa missão acaba se desenrolando em um caminho bem inesperado. A narrativa principal tenta demonstrar como, em uma luta entre "bem" e "mal", os papéis podem se inverter em um piscar de olhos. E, mais ainda, questiona se o "bem" sequer existiu em primeiro lugar.

[+] Grandes personagens
A história é conduzida por uma dupla de personagens que considero muito marcantes, ambos com histórias trágicas e interpretações brilhantes. O texto é bem-sucedido em fazer com que nos importemos e fiquemos do lado deles, o que é essencial para o final ser impactante.

[+] Cenários de encher os olhos
Os gráficos são muito bonitos para a época. O jogo aproveita muito bem a ideia de uma cidade flutuante e cria cenários detalhados e criativos. É difícil esquecer a primeira vez que você avista a cidade.

[~] Algumas decisões no ato final
Na reta final, a história se torna mais convoluta. Os personagens tomam decisões apressadas e arriscadas que parecem ter sido feitas apenas para o roteiro seguir em frente. Talvez um pouco mais de tempo de jogo ajudasse nessa parte.

[-] Combate simplório e o uso das skylines
O combate do jogo é muito básico e não se destaca: é atirar e correr. A mecânica de poderes é fraca e pouco dinâmica; você facilmente consegue terminar o jogo sem usar todos. As skylines prometem um gameplay com potencial, mas são pouco exploradas. Elas poderiam ter sido utilizadas mais vezes para criar situações de combate mais criativas e interessantes.

[-] Sobre as DLCs
Acabei não gostando das DLCs. A história é encerrada de forma acertada no jogo principal, e essa extensão não me pareceu necessária.

[*] Curiosidades sobre o desenvolvimento
Esse jogo teve um desenvolvimento conturbado e bem documentado. Caso tenha curiosidade, recomendo buscar mini documentários que contam melhor como esse jogo poderia ter sido diferente sem as limitações de hardware da época.

185028923.review:
[h1] BioShock Infinite [/h1]
Третья часть серии BioShock, где действие игры происходит в альтернативной реальности и отличается от первых двух частей, находящихся в подводном городе Рапчур. В BioShock Infinite игроки погружаются или лучше сказать взмывают в уникальный мир воздушного города Колумбия, который сочетает в себе элементы стимпанка, американского патриотизма и религиозной символики.

[h2] Основные особенности игры [/h2]
Колумбия — воздушный город, созданный как утопическое отражение идеалов американской мечты конца XIX — начала XX века. Однако, как и в Рапчуре, здесь все далеко от идеала. Это город, утопия с элементами расизма, религиозного фанатизма и социальной несправедливости. Игроки начинают своё путешествие в Колумбии в качестве частного детектива ДеВитта Букера, человека с туманным прошлым, которому поручено найти девушку по имени Элизабет. Город наполнен яркими, но тревожными ландшафтами, с видами на небо и воздушные дороги, чем нельзя похвастаться другим играм в плане дизайна.

[h2] Геймплей [/h2]
Как и в предыдущих играх серии, BioShock Infinite использует уникальную систему плазмидов (здесь они называются "Vigors"), которые открывают в нас особые способности, такие как управление гравитацией, молниями или даже возможность контролировать врагов. Кроме того, в игре присутствуют новые механики, такие как использование «воксовых канатов» — воздушных путей, которые позволяют игроку перемещаться по огромному городу наслаждаясь пейзажами и убивая противников спрыгивая с них.

[h2] Элизабета [/h2]
Не могу упустить возможность описания такой особы как Элизабет. Она ключевая фигура в сюжете игры, обладающая уникальной способностью открывать разломы во времени и пространстве, через которые можно попасть в альтернативные реальности. Это добавляет в игру элементы стратегии, так как с помощью её способностей можно изменять ход сражений и манипулировать окружением. Элизабет также выступает спутницей игрока на протяжении большей части игры, её взаимодействие с Букером влияет на сюжет и атмосферу.

[h2] Сюжет [/h2]
Сюжет BioShock Infinite наполнен многочисленными философскими, политическими и религиозными темами. В основе истории лежит концепция альтернативных реальностей и судьбы, исследуется тема фанатизма, расизма и классового неравенства. Игра погружает в философские размышления о свободе воли и последствиях действий героев. В сюжете присутствуют неожиданные повороты, которые заставляют переосмыслить всё, что происходило ранее. Конец игры знаменит своей глубиной и многозначностью, предоставляя игроку множество интерпретаций.

[h1] DLC [/h1]
BioShock Infinite был дополнен несколькими значимыми DLC, которые расширяют как сюжетную линию игры, так и её геймплей.

[h2] The Burial at Sea (2 главы) [/h2]
The Burial at Sea — два сюжетных дополнения, которые возвращают игрока в знакомые воды, где разворачивается дополнительная часть истории. Сюжет начинается с того, что Букер и Элизабет оказываются в Рапчуре, но это уже другая реальность, и город выглядит по-другому. Игроки вновь встречают знакомых персонажей и сталкиваются с новыми угрозами. Сюжет дополнения переплетает события BioShock Infinite с первой частью игры, предлагая зрелищные моменты и новые тайны.
В дополнении The Burial at Sea появляется новый взгляд на персонажей, особенно на Элизабет, которая здесь выглядит иначе, и её отношения с Букером раскрываются под новым углом. Также здесь возвращаются элементы первой части BioShock, такие как геймплей с обилием оружия и системой адаптации врагов. Вторая часть DLC завершает сюжетную линию и предлагает фанатам сильное эмоциональное завершение, которое связывает все части серии. [spoiler] Очень удивило и обрадовало то что нам наконец дают поиграть за Элизабет, да еще и реализовано все в стиле стелс-экшн [/spoiler]

[h2] Clash in the Clouds [/h2]
Clash in the Clouds — аркадное дополнение, которое фокусируется на битвах с волнами врагов. Здесь нет сложной сюжетной линии, но это отличная возможность для игроков, которые хотят проверить свои боевые навыки в различных аренах. Это дополнение предлагает новые карты, врагов и коллекционные предметы, которые можно заработать в процессе сражений, а также таблицу лидерства.

[h2] Columbia’s Finest [/h2]  
Не значительный, но очень приятный DLC с набором, предоставляющим игроку дополнительные бонусы, такие как оружие, улучшения и другие предметы, которые помогут в сражениях в игре.

[h1] Подвожу итог [/h1]
BioShock Infinite — это мощное произведение в мире видеоигр, которое сочетает в себе захватывающий сюжет, глубокие философские размышления и оригинальные игровые механики. Он расширяет идеи, заложенные в предыдущих частях серии, и ставит новые вопросы о природе свободы воли, расовых и социальных вопросов.
The Burial at Sea, углубляет взаимодействие с миром и персонажами, раскрывая новые горизонты и предлагая значимые сюжетные повороты. Игра остаётся актуальной и после выхода дополнений, так как они не только добавляют контент, но и расширяют лор игры, давая фанатам серии пищу для размышления.

[h3] "Мы плаваем в разных морях, но выходим на тот же берег." [/h3] (с) Элизабет

185005669.review:
Bioshock Infinite is a fun single-player game. Considering it was released back in 2013, the graphics still hold up remarkably well with today's visual art and style. The Bioshock series of video games are masterpieces in their own right, with exceptional art and storytelling.

Although there isn’t much replayability, I understand there are multiple endings to the game that I have not yet explored. I am currently replaying the game because, when I was younger, I played it on a laptop without a dedicated graphics card. I wanted to experience the game in better quality and higher resolution.

One thing I’ve noticed is the stunning use of god rays and the reflections in water and mirrors, which make me appreciate why technologies like ray tracing exist. If the developers were to create a remaster, I would expect them to optimize the game for modern graphical technology, showcasing how much more visually stunning it could become.

While I don’t think the game necessarily needs a reboot or remaster, it has been over 10 years since its original release, and it would be interesting to see how it could evolve visually with today’s advancements.

184982478.review:
Bioshock Infinite consegue fazer algo bem incrível. Superar o plot twist do primeiro jogo e literalmente inverter o cenário do fundo do mar para prédios acima das nuvens de uma maneira espetacular. 

Eu havia jogado recentemente o primeiro jogo da franquia e a sensação de chegar em rapture e columbia são muito opostas. Enquanto rapture pare completamente destruída por malucos e big daddies. Columbia é a representação so verdadeiro sonho americano. Desde a chegada até o momento do circo você fica com aquele desconforto de que sabe que a qualquer momento algo vai dar errado... e dá.

Joguei esse jogo no meu antigo pc que não rodava muita coisa em 2021 e pro mais que tenha sido muito tempo depois do lançamento, o jogo envelheceu muito bem. As habilidades junto de um esquema menos agressivo de cover shooter combinam muito até hoje com o gênero. Na verdade títulos como wolfenstein se utilizam disso até hoje e funcionam muito bem. 

O protagonista (Booker) é interessante, assim como a Elizabeth que é muito boa tanto como parceira nos combates (te jogando itens que ela tira de você sabe onde) quanto uma ferramenta narrativa que te prende ao enredo até final. E que final! Adorei que assim como no primeiro jogo assim que você vê os créditos, sua mente começa a te lembrar de momentos em que o jogo estava te dando dicas do enredo que você simplesmente não percebeu.

Por fim, acho que assim como o primeiro esse jogo é essencial. Tem uma base tão sólida que mesmo depois de 12 anos ainda continua muito bom.

无限还是很对生化奇兵的味，一开始就把你丢进一个世外世界但是什么都不告诉你，战斗和探索的时候也有那种古典音乐播放，一边听着古典音乐一遍射杀敌人有种教父的感觉。
这次是在1912年，非常有那个年代蒸汽朋克的味，城市在天上，风景很浪漫很美，还引入了女主伊丽莎白的设定，而且女主不像生4的碍事梨，会自己跟着你不用管她，会帮忙开锁，找钱子弹血包魔力给你，还有切换平行世界的异能，很多时候能拖不少好东西来，还能拖个拿加特林的机器人和机枪炮塔，只能说女主的能力实在是太惊艳了。带着被关起来很久的美女和枪一边见闻沿途风景一边逃出生天非常浪漫非常old fashion但我非常吃这套，真的很酷。
枪械手感优化了不少，还有一些新的异能可以使用，引入了护盾可以呼吸回血。
非常电影化的叙事，演出很棒，音乐编排也很厉害，是随战斗而来的。救伊丽莎白那段紧迫感十足，女主在宣传海报上开窗真引来了海报上的鸟。
别的游戏是越玩剧情越明白，本作却是越玩越迷越烧脑了。结尾也是神回，结局信息量很大，也闭环上了，理清一些之后发现这叙事手法是真牛逼，太震撼了，从来没见过这么神的叙事手法，但剧情和设定说实话太复杂了，还要慢慢理。不过就算看不懂，庞大的信息量和神回结尾也足够带给玩家巨大的震撼。本作称为无限也算是一语双关了。
海葬DLC里对一代的故事衔接做得还行，就是伊丽莎白表现说实话有点太圣母了，动机太差了，像他妈一代被方丹拿了杀手锏的主角，个人是不太满意海葬的剧情和角色性能的，但也算是圆上了一代的设定吧。
还有伊丽莎白会在你弹吉他的时候一起唱歌。
不过这代的保存机制感觉做得不够人性化，地图也删除了（虽然更有代入感），以及没有像一代那样的血包和蓝包（虽然地图里有不少补给，也可以呼吸回盾）更考验对高压的应对能力。
但瑕不掩瑜，本作着实非常新颖，在十二年前2013年绝对够让人眼前一亮的本世纪最佳反乌托邦神作之一，甚至感觉影响了后边的原子之心，放到今天仍然值得我们细细品鉴。

184802672.review:
* SPOILERS AHEAD *

Introduction:
	This story revolves around a man named Booker DeWitt, known also as “The False Shepherd,” and a young woman named Elizabeth, or “The Lamb,” whom he is attempting to smuggle out of the dystopian city of Columbia. At its core, the game functions as an escort mission but without the typical risks and hindrances associated with the genre–thankfully so. Elizabeth cannot take damage which eliminates any encumbrance on the player; On the contrary, she actively supports the player with Silver, Salts, and ammunition throughout the journey. In certain combat scenarios, Elizabeth can create “Tears” which grant the player extra mobility options (e.g., Sky-hooks), weapons, and other forms of assistance like automatic turrets and additional cover.

Player choices:
	The game features a total of 14 weapons, 12 of which can be upgraded, although players are limited to carrying only two weapons at a time. As a result of this, I felt discouraged to spend any serious amount of time with weapons I had not invested Silver into upgrading. Eventually, I settled on the sniper rifle—hip-firing during close encounters and using the scope for long-range engagements—while relying on the Volley Gun for boss skirmishes.
	The game is designed as a linear experience with exploration largely confined to locked rooms and short alleyways. That said, the game includes a notable experiment with a semi-open-world section, where the player is tasked with opening three Tears. In this sequence, the order of events is left to the player’s discretion as they explore a contained part of Columbia using in-game maps for guidance.

Strengths and weaknesses:
	The storytelling in Bioshock Infinite is one of its greatest strengths. I was particularly impressed by the symbolic mirroring in the second act after the player's fall from Monument Island. Up to this point, Columbia is presented as a utopia, with heavenly views and an economy seemingly built on goodwill. One shop sign reads,  “You are on your Honor! Put money in basket. The Founders thank you!” This literal descent from grace marks a dramatic thematic shift where Booker DeWitt is exposed to the grievances of Columbia’s working class, including inadequate compensation and the existence of segregation laws.
	One criticism I have regarding the characters are the ineffectual and ultimately inconsequential actions of the central antagonist, Zachary Comstock. When the protagonist finally confronts Comstock he admits, “DeWitt, I'm a fool. I've sent mighty armies to stop you; I've rained fire on you from above. I did all of that to keep you from her [Elizabeth], when all I needed to do was tell her the truth.” While Comstock’s actions are necessary to enable the many gameplay scenarios, this confession diminishes the weight of the journey by making his grand opposition feel futile. Perhaps this was intentional–to contrast his grand ambitions with the simplicity of what was needed–honesty. However, I can’t help but feel the player's journey is somewhat invalidated by this anticlimactic and underwhelming confrontation with Comstock.

184789375.review:
Avaliação: 9/10 – Eu só queria um café, mas ganhei um pesadelo com superpoderes. ☕🤯

BioShock Infinite é basicamente o que acontece quando você mistura uma cidade flutuante, um cara com um bigode sensacional e uma garota que abre portais para o multiverso – ou seja, uma bagunça alucinante e complexa que te faz pensar “o que diabos está acontecendo aqui?”. A história é mais enrolada que meu cabo de fone e, no final, você vai se sentir como se tivesse saído de uma roda-gigante… mas com um revólver e uma dor de cabeça insuportável. 🎡🔫

A Elizabeth é tipo aquela amiga que te acompanha em festas, canta músicas antigas e sempre tem algo inesperado na manga, como abrir um portal para outra dimensão enquanto você está tentando entender o que está acontecendo com a sua vida. Ela é boa companheira, até você perceber que sua única missão é salvá-la, mas também... destrui-la? Não é exatamente claro, mas ei, estamos falando de viagem no tempo aqui.

Pontos positivos: Gráficos lindos, uma história que te deixa sem saber se você deve aplaudir ou pedir um atestado de psicólogo. E claro, ação! MUITA AÇÃO!

Pontos negativos: Se você é do tipo que gosta de entender tudo na hora, aqui não vai ser o caso. Prepare-se para ter a sensação de que alguém colocou LSD na sua sopa e te mandou pra um jogo de tiro.

Em resumo: Jogue se você quer questionar sua sanidade, dar risada do caos e, ao final, procurar um terapeuta. 💥🧠

184760063.review:
Bioshock Infinite is a remarkable achievement in gaming, blending thought-provoking storytelling, breathtaking visuals, and intense gameplay into an unforgettable experience. Set in the floating city of Columbia, the game creates a world that is both beautiful and unsettling, full of rich detail and layered symbolism.

The story of Booker DeWitt and Elizabeth is one of gaming’s finest. It explores themes of redemption, choice, and the nature of reality, all culminating in an ending that stays with you long after the credits roll. Elizabeth is a standout companion, with her intelligence and emotional depth elevating the narrative to new heights.

Gameplay is fast-paced and engaging, with the Skyhook system offering thrilling combat mobility. Vigors and an arsenal of weapons provide plenty of room for creative playstyles, while the tactical AI and sprawling environments keep encounters dynamic.

The soundtrack and voice acting are stellar, perfectly complementing the game’s tone and setting. Whether you’re exploring Columbia’s sunlit streets or unraveling its darker secrets, Bioshock Infinite is a masterclass in atmosphere.

This is a must-play for anyone who values storytelling in games. It’s an experience that challenges, surprises, and captivates, cementing its place as one of the greatest games of all time.

184675883.review:
Después de haber jugado bastantes horas al título y encontrarme en búsqueda de lograr el platino, puedo confirmar de forma precisa que ha sido una experiencia fabulosa. No solo Bioshock Infinite vuelve a causar esa sensación y esencia encontrada en el primer juego del título (Bioshock) sino que da un cierre espectacular a una historia atrapante con escenarios profundos y distintas particularidades misteriosas de los personajes, que finalmente le dan un tinte intrigante. 
Por los motivos mencionados como muchos otros que se van logrando percibir a lo largo del juego, lo recomiendo totalmente.
Por ultimo, aclaro que Bioshock Infinite al igual que el resto del título, no es un juego para pasarlo una única vez, sino mas bien un juego que puede ser explorado en distintas vertientes como así también modalidades y nunca va a dejar de sorprender o intrigar. A medida que uno vuelve a andar sobre sus propios pasos logra re descubrir circunstancias o quizás cosas que en un primer momento se habían pasado por alto. Lo cual termina siendo uno de los motivos principales que logra enriquecer la experiencia de juego.

Playing on hard, normal is too easy. Limiting guns to 2 was frustrating but manageable. Autosaves that are so far apart means I'd would have to backtrack each scavenging, upgrades, lore reading. It's workable mix of challenging and gives more stakes in the encounters.

184603883.review:
Неплохая игра, но плохой биошок.
Прошел подряд все три части и эта - самая слабая из них. Первые две даже сейчас ощущаются, будто вышли недавно, если закрыть глаза на графику. От третьей сразу отдают эпохой PS3 и X360.
Упростили игру практически по всем параметрам. Вместо имерсив сима с кучей вариантов как проходить игру с хорошим дизайном карт - сделали арена-шутер. При этом убрали зачем-то возможность таскать все оружие и оставили 2 шт., как делали во всех шутанах того времени. Убрали прокачку с помощью кучи эликсиров, зато сделали 4 шмотки из которых реально полезных несколько штук. Убрали взломы, изменили в худшую сторону механику прокачки оружия и плазмидов за адам.
Зачем-то убрали субтитры из аудиодневников, да можно прочитать их, но это сильно бьет по атмосфере. для не англоговорящих превратили их в записки. 
С сюжетом Левин наворотил какую-то хрень. В первых частях все было однозначно понятно и для расширения лора можно было послушать аудиодневники. Тут же, чтобы понять, что вообще происходит без дневников вообще никак и то скорее всего нужно будет лезть на ютуб. При этом опять же вырезали разные варианты концовки игры.
Из однозначных плюсов могу отметить разве что стрельбу, появился импакт. 
Ну и Трой Бейкер молодец, играет хорошо. Только прошел Индиану Джонса и здесь снова знакомый голос.

184603647.review: This game was absolutely amazing. Even a year after playing it all the way through, some aspects of the underlying story still stick with me. I won't speak much to gameplay, because while I enjoyed the game immensely that wasn't what made this a true experience. All of the BioShock games were excellent and a great journey - certainly at the top of my list for enjoyment. Infinite was a little different though. For me, it was the visually impactful segments and the deeply moving moments throughout. Everyone connects with storytelling differently, but this one resonated with me a great deal. For reference, my beloved list of games like this one are F.E.A.R. Perseus Mandate and 2, Dead Space 3, Mass Effect 2, Dragon Age II, Syberia I and II, The Longest Journey and Dreamfall, Half Life 2, Unreal II and a handful more. This game was at the upper end of that list and I wish I could have stayed in the Infinite world for so much longer. The ending for me was like the ending of the Hyperion/Endymion novel series - I understood it and knew at a visceral level that it was coming, but it took me a while to accept it because I was so invested in the main characters and I didn't want them to go. It is so rare for a story to sit inside me casting around for a place to rest amongst my values and character. In 40 years, I have experienced this with a very small collection of books, movies and games. BioShock Infinite managed to find a place there.

游戏性相比初代已经下降了很多，主要是沉浸模拟元素的缺失。

体验变得很线性，探索大幅减少但仍然保有一个若有若无的量，但这对本作快节奏的预期体验反而是种累赘——玩家会像有强迫症一样为升级资源不停在场景里翻找，而大部分情况下其实是没探索的必要的，做多了真的很烦人，一开始就别让玩家有要满地找资源升级的心理负担更好。
随着体验变线性，叙事也更变成几乎纯用脚本演出而不是前作的环境叙事，依赖脚本又让互动元素减少，最直观的体现就是本作的超能力几乎全是战斗专用（而且是直接对人的，水洼都没几个了），而线性关卡不用在复杂场景里反复穿梭也让玩家失去了前作里那样体验自己对世界所造成的影响的机会——虽然本作里玩家对游戏世界本来也没什么影响力。

探索的缺席让更多的战斗加入了进来，但战斗本身也算不上特别有趣，敌人是很普通的几乎没战术的近战和远程步兵，特殊敌人的打法也没有根本区别——也许得上不同的buff，但总之都是不停射，不会有什么战术考虑——枪械设计也是几乎任何fps游戏都有的那几种（后期还一堆换皮枪）。前作的情况虽然也好不到哪里去，但丰富的互动性是可以掩盖战斗的单调的，你可以潜行/看电子斗蛐蛐/看他们试图用医疗站时被破解过的机器电死/还有更容易触发的环境击杀等等。至于超能力战斗，前文说过本作的超能力过于直接且目的单一，这在减少了乐趣的同时也很容易创造出一招鲜的格局，玩家大可只用一种技能和武器来战斗，其余的工具都并非无可取代。

剧情：初来哥伦比亚确实会被其社会和历史的美丽和丑陋迷住，但到了后期本作还是变成了科幻亲情戏的陈腔滥调，虽然这更多只是本人的好恶而已，但我有时真的感觉某些人离了爱就说不出话了。必须承认肯列文对美国社会的阴暗面是有见地的，但相对的，游戏里一谈到变革就会变得异常粗浅甚至尴尬——虽然这是本来就很暴力的反乌托邦但你们反抗的方式好暴力所以革命坏坏什么什么的。这某种意义上也是政治正确，一种“虽然社会有问题但也没必要改”的折中说法。肯列文大概是将销魂城和哥伦比亚当成了一种空中楼阁而不是现实的镜子，虽然也不能因此责怪他，但就把这么好的舞台拿来演亲情戏在我看来属实有点浪费。

好评是打给前期的哥伦比亚塑造的，大概吧

183938622.review:
▎BioShock Infinite

BioShock Infinite - це шутер від першої особи, розроблений Irrational Games та випущений у 2013 році. Гра є третім випуском у серії BioShock, хоча її події не пов'язані безпосередньо з попередніми частинами.

▎Сюжет

Дія відбувається у 1912 році у вигаданому небесному місті Колумбія. Гравець грає за Букера ДеВіта, колишнього детектива та борця з Британською імперією, який отримав завдання врятувати молоду дівчину на ім'я Елліс, що була заточена в цій утопії.

Гравець досліджує місто, в якому панують расизм, релігійний фанатизм та тоталітаризм. Сюжет має глибокі філософські теми та розглядає питання свободи, ідентичності та вибору.

▎Ігровий процес

1. Бойова механіка: Гравець використовує широкий арсенал зброї та «Відкриття» - спеціальні здібності, які надають магічні можливості, такі як управління елементами чи маніпуляція оточенням.

2. Дослідження: Ігровий світ багатий на деталі, і гравцям пропонується досліджувати різні локації, виконувати побічні завдання та щоразу відкривати нові аспекти сюжету.

3. Помічник: Елліс, яку ви рятуєте, є не лише метою, а й активним помічником, який допомагає в бою, надаючи ресурси чи створюючи відволікаючі елементи.

▎Графіка та звукове оформлення

BioShock Infinite відзначається вражаючою графікою та стилізацією, що відображає епоху, в якій відбуваються події. Саундтрек і звукові ефекти додають атмосферності та занурюють у світ гри.

▎Заключення

BioShock Infinite отримала високу оцінку критиків завдяки своєму сюжетному розвитку, персонажам та геймплейним механікам. Гра пропонує насичений досвід, який залишає гравців із безліччю запитань і вражень на довгий час. Якщо вам цікаві конкретні аспекти гри, запитуйте!

183648789.review:
I actually wasn't planning on writing a review, but jesus christ I just finished both this AND the DLC, and I have a lot to talk about so here goes. Going into this game, I didn't know what to expect. I was expecting Bioshock 1 to be good, it ended up being one of my favourite games of all time. I was expecting Bioshock 2 to be good, and while it didn't turn out nearly as good as the original, I still loved it overall, especially Minerva's Den. But with this game, I had no idea what to expect because this is such a divisive game among the fanbase. Some love it, some hate it. And where do I stand? Right in the middle. 

Let's start with the gameplay, which is the aspect I have the least to talk about. I found it decent. The main issue with the game is it's incredibly easy gameplay, because while it can be fun at times, especially in large combat encounters, it can start to feel at times to be repetitive and stale, especially since there really isn't any noticible spike in difficulty, resulting in repetitive and boring gameplay. However, it wasn't nearly as bad as I'm making it sound like, and overall wasn't that bad. I got used to it after a while and found myself having fun with the gameplay, but it definitely overstayed its welcome for me and was not nearly as good as the original's or the second for that matter. 

But what really made me want to talk about this and ESPECIALLY the DLC is without a doubt the most divisive aspect about this game: the story. The base game's story and Burial At Sea, to me at least, have one primary thing in common: they are very fun stories, and are easily enjoyable. But to say that they make sense would just be wrong. Let's start with the base game, spoilers ahead. Now, I will actually say I really dug the story for the most part at the beginning. Because it was simple. It was about a man trying to save a girl. Was it basic? Yes. Was it worse than the previous installments? Yes. But it was ultimately servicable. But then all hell breaks loose when the game completely shifts and we start hopping between universes. This is the moment when the game stops making sense. If we're hopping through different universes, is the comstock we see at the end the same comstock from the beginning? Why can't we just escape to a better universe instead of having to stay with Columbia? Surely there's a better universe, and one without Columbia? I just didn't really like the tone the game was taking, so you can imagine my reaction to the ending, which had me feeling extremely mixed. On the one hand, this ending was extremely cool. The way it all clicked in together with the plot and Booker's real identity was insane to witness, along with Elizabeth's change and drowning Comstock in anger. However, it also felt incredibly rushed, seeing this transformation just happen in the last 20 minutes just felt disorientating as all of this knowledge was thrown on top of me, making my brain collapse on itself. And then it ties into the original games. I didn't really mind it. That was another thing I was very confused about throughout the entire game, wondering why this was called Bioshock when it had nothing to do with the previous installments. Going into the different universes and revealing the different lighthouses... just talking about it now makes me confused, and makes my brain hurt. I just think that there was a way easier way of piling this information onto us. However, overall, I did like Bioshock Infinite. It was a nice game that probably wouldn't stick with me like Bioshock 1 has, but I enjoyed it, but can definitely agree this was the worse in the franchise. Burial At Sea hasn't swayed my opinion of this game, but it has muddied it, and left me feeling more lost, more confused, and yet more emotionally resonant with this game. 

The gameplay of Burial At Sea is good, at least with episode 2, mainly because I love stealth in games, and I really dug the gameplay of episode 2. Nothing much to say about episode 1 overall, since both the story and gameplay were quite basic and not much to really ride home about, however I must say that seeing Rapture not only in this perfect setting before the war and seeing the beauty of it combined with the Bioshock Infinite graphics was just breath taking, and really transported me into this time. But of course, I have to talk about the story, because while for the majority of the first episode I was left feeling unfulfilled with the story, the ending shocked me, as I honestly didn't expect Booker to be killed by Elizabeth at the end. It honestly made sense too, tying in with the base game's ending and finally explaining why Elizabeth was down here. But what really was crazy was the second episode. I loved how after an entire game and a DLC, we can FINALLY play as Elizabeth, and while I was disappointed we weren't able to utilise her powers with the tears, it made up with the fact that we finally had a more unique gameplay style now, having to focus more on stealth and strategy rather than just brute forcing every situation like before. 

Episode 2's story however left me in shock, and I'm not sure if it was in a good way or a bad way, but it left an impression on me that much can be said. Having Atlas and Ryan show up throughout the game as guides really did connect this all back to Bioshock 1, and made me rekindle my love that I had for that game. In a way, this DLC strengthened it, and showed me what I loved about the first game, that being the intricate gameplay, and the twists and turns of the story. While neither was as good as in this DLC, with the gameplay being worse and the twists and turns also being handled worse, it was still an enjoyable time. And having it all connect back with Jack, having to get the activation phrase to save Sally, and the insane reveal that Elizabeth was the one that hijacked the plane, it was just satisfying. In a way, this episode reminded me a lot of Evangelion, specifically the final movie in the series: 3.0 + 1.0: Thrice Upon A Time. That movie did what this episode did: wrapped up an incredible story with a finale that most of the time didn't make sense in the slightest, and yet ended up being incredibly emotional as a final farewell. 

Overall, this game and especially Burial At Sea aren't perfect, nor can I say that they're masterpieces. They're convoluted, canon shattering messes, and yet they have something that most games nowadays don't have anymore: passion. This game was made with love, and while it didn't turn out nearly the way I expected, this was still an incredibly heartfelt, even beautiful conclusion to one of my favourite franchises in gaming history. I know that one day Bioshock 4 will come out, and I have no doubt in my mind that it will at least be good, but I don't know if we need it. If you asked me about Bioshock 4 after the first two games, I would've said absolutely, but now, even though I can't say that Burial At Sea was a perfect conclusion in the slightest, it was such a beautiful sendoff that it will be hard to replicate that. 

To one of the greatest trilogies of all time, and to the one of the most beautiful journeys I have ever had in a story. Thank you, for rekindling my love for video games. Farewell Bioshock.

183633927.review:
Fabulous RPG game still even if has been published for more than ten years. I played this game multiple times around these years, and finally passed the 1999 hardcore mode this time.

Rich story and great plot[spoiler]about the trials of redemption in the multi-universe setting (we only play one trial in the game, which is actually one of the many)[/spoiler]. Nice gameplay. Combining standard shooting with multiple weapons and magics leads to various battling strategies. Also, compared to BioShock 1, Elizabeth is a great companion throughout the game, reducing loneliness during the play. Though I like the type of character who doesn't speak, such as Gordon Freeman in the HL series and Morgan Yu in Prey (2017), the conversation between Booker DeWitt and Elizabeth from time to time still makes me enjoy the game a lot. At least Elizabeth is a lively portal master rather than simply a companion cube as in Portal.

I think the only regrets are two. Story-wise, I feel the storyline pushes too fast. Some parts of the story, like the Vox revolt, can be longer so that the Vox allies won't become the enemy too soon. Gameplay-wise, the sky-line system is a fancy idea, but it is more like an auxiliary thing during battling. Of course, we can choose to fight on the sky-line, but it does not come with many interesting strategies.

[h2] 个人体验有剧透[/h2]
这游戏对我来说相当有“年味”。我每年过年的时候都要玩一遍生化奇兵无限，伴着外面烟花炮竹噼噼啪啪的响声听游戏的音乐。
之前和群友谈到这个时他们说我是舍不得伊丽莎白、舍不得安娜，我无法描述自己的感觉于是嗯嗯嗯应付了过去。
其实一点也不是。
玩了数不清多少遍，早已经麻木了。我面无表情听她歌唱，把她救出来带她寻找自己的命运，我亲眼看着她溺死Booker，又目视她经受磨难后被大老爹杀死，一遍又一遍。
一切都早已命中注定了，她的过去、她的未来都无可更改。
也许在我那忘却的记忆中我曾深受触动，但现在她对我而言只不过是剧情演出，游戏的一部分流程罢了。原来伊丽莎白早已经死了，到底是我亲手杀死了心中的她，就在我一次次的游戏之中。
现在找出原因了：安娜·德威特，她的过去、她的未来都让人毫无想象的空间、毫无留白的余地。她如烟花般绚烂也应此物般寂寥，诚如春节夜晚那个孤身一人的我。。。。。。
